name: Tick-Tock
description:
(This game is intended to be played with a butterfly or jitter click method. If you know neither of these you can use the spacebar bug, although I recommend not using it.)

(I would also  please suggest not to play it on browser as it is a 3d project so it is slightly laggy and the graphics are extremely poor)

Tick-Tock is a game that I have made for the  Brackeys Game Jam 2021.2. This  game is a strategy/management game where you need to manage   a bunch of clocks   throughout    ingame week. The clocks gears break mess up over time and you need to wind them back up. You lose if you break more then one clock and you win if you get to 1PM.    The theme of the jam is Let There Be Chaos. This game is very chaotic. It starts of very simple but through the different shifts the clocks  break faster and your employer,  Clock Maker adds more clocks to your room. This game was made in only seven days so some parts of the game are a little ruff around the edges  , but mostly its a fun time and I recommend playing it.

Controls

Left Click - Interact

X - Close Clock Menu

(Note. if you want to restart a shift dont spam x multiple times only press it once at the end of the shift)

This game incudes extra  and fun features such as

-Dialogue/Tutorial

-Achievements and Local  save for them

-Extremely hard gameplay and high difficulty curve

-Pretty nice 3d graphics + Post Processing
